## Descriptive Statistics

Statistics for Food Scientists

***Chapter Commentary:***

Maria is given a tour of the BBQ sauce production plant to understand how manufacturing works (Understanding the food production flow makes the data more relatable!ðŸ˜‰). The plant manager, Lisa, takes her from ingredient handling to mixing, heating, filling, and hourly viscosity checks for quality control. Lisa introduces a new high-speed filling line and asks Maria to production data to confirm whether the new system truly improves performance.

To describe our data, we utilise summary statistics to give an idea of viscouscity levels in the individual production line. I love R and python, but let's try R for this bookðŸ˜Š!

Let's first import our mock data

```{r}
#| label: Load Data

#load packages
pacman::p_load(
  rio,  #for importing data

#Import Data

head(bbq) #Let's return the top 6 rows
```

Some summary statistics explored in the book include the:

| Measure of Central location | What is it?                       |
|-----------------------------|-----------------------------------|
| Mean                        | Mathematical Average              |
| Median                      | Middle value. The 50th percentile |
| Mode                        | Most frequently occurring value   |
